Title: Wilms Tumor
ProbableCases: A 3 yr old child presented with a UNILATERAL, LARGE ABDOMINAL MASS which extend down the pelvis. Histology show SHEETS OF BLUE CELLS.

Title: Homer Wright Pseudo Rosettes(Neuroblastoma Histology)
ProbableCases: A 2 yr old child presented with a LARGE ABDOMINAL MASS and WEIGHT LOSS.He has DEEP BLUISH DISCOLORATION OF SKIN (BLUEBERRY MUFFIN BABY). Blood - ELEVATED LEVELS OF VMA(vanillyl mandellic acid).

Title: Cystic Fibrosis
ProbableCases: A 10 yr old child is Hospitalized with PNEUMONIA and DIFFICULTY IN BREATHING. His stools are LARGE and Contains UNDIGESTED PARTICLES. His SWEAT CHLORIDE LEVEL- ELEVATED.

Title: Sudden infant death Syndrome(SIDS)
ProbableCases: A 6 month old baby dies SUDDENLY with UNEXPLAINED cause even after PROPER INVESTIGATION, AUTOPSY and CLINICAL HISTORY.

Title: Phenylketonuria
ProbableCases: A 6 month old baby has REDUCED INTELLECTUAL ABILITY. His blood sample shows ELEVATED levels of PHENYLALANINE.
